const sigPreempt = _SIGURG



func initsig(preinit bool) {

,,,

func sighandler(sig uint32, info *siginfo, ctxt unsafe.Pointer, gp *g) {
,,,
if sig == sigPreempt { // å¦‚æœæ˜¯æŠ¢å ä¿¡å·
// Might be a preemption signal.

// æ‰§è¡ŒæŠ¢å 
func doSigPreempt(gp *g, ctxt *sigctxt) {
if wantAsyncPreempt(gp) && isAsyncSafePoint(gp, ctxt.sigpc(), ctxt.sigsp(), ctxt.siglr()) {
// Inject a call to asyncPreempt.
ctxt.pushCall(funcPC(asyncPreempt)) // æ‰§è¡ŒæŠ¢å çš„å…³é”®æ–¹æ³•
}



// Acknowledge the preemption.

atomic.Xadd(&gp.m.preemptGen, 1) } goåœ¨å¯åŠ¨æ—¶æŠŠæ‰€æœ‰çš„ä¿¡å·éƒ½æ³¨å†Œäº†ä¸€éï¼ŒåŒ…æ‹¬å¯é çš„ä¿¡å·ã€‚(æˆªå›¾ä¸ºéƒ¨åˆ†)

func schedule() {
,,,

func execute(gp *g, inheritTime bool) {

g.m.p.ptr().schedtick++

,,,
}



func sysmon(){
,,,
// retake Pâ€™s blocked in syscalls
// and preempt long running Gâ€™s
if retake(now) != 0 {
idle = 0
} else {
idle++
}
,,,
}



// è®°å½•æ¯æ¬¡æ£€æŸ¥çš„ä¿¡æ¯
type sysmontick struct {
schedtick uint32
schedwhen int64
syscalltick uint32
syscallwhen int64
}



const forcePreemptNS = 10 * 1000 * 1000 // æŠ¢å çš„æ—¶é—´é˜ˆå€¼ 10ms



func retake(now int64) uint32 {
n := 0
lock(&allpLock)
for i := 0; i < len(allp); i++ {
p := allp[i]
if p == nil {
continue
}
pd := &p.sysmontick
s := p.status
if s == Prunning || s == _Psyscall {
// Preempt G if itâ€™s running for too long.
t := int64(_p.schedtick)
if int64(pd.schedtick) != t {
pd.schedtick = uint32(t)
pd.schedwhen = now // è®°å½•å½“å‰æ£€æµ‹æ—¶é—´
// ä¸Šæ¬¡æ—¶é—´åŠ 10mså°äºå½“å‰æ—¶é—´ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆè¯´æ˜è¶…è¿‡ï¼Œéœ€è¿›è¡ŒæŠ¢å ã€‚
} else if pd.schedwhen+forcePreemptNS <= now {
preemptone(p)
}
}



    // ä¸‹é¢çœç•¥æ‰æ…¢ç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨çš„æŠ¢å æè¿°ã€‚

    if s == _Psyscall {

        // åŸå­æ›´ä¸ºpçŠ¶æ€ä¸ºç©ºé—²çŠ¶æ€

        if atomic.Cas(&_p_.status, s, _Pidle) {

            ,,,

            handoffp(_p_)  // å¼ºåˆ¶å¸è½½P, ç„¶åstartmæ¥å…³è”

        }

    ,,, }


func preemptone(p *p) bool {
mp := p.m.ptr()
,,,



gp.preempt = true



,,,

gp.stackguard0 = stackPreempt



// Request an async preemption of this P.

if preemptMSupported && debug.asyncpreemptoff == 0 {

    _p_.preempt = true

    preemptM(mp)

}



return true } å‘é€SIGURGä¿¡å·ï¼Ÿ

func preemptM(mp *m) {

// This architecture doesnâ€™t support ctxt.pushCall
// yet, so doSigPreempt wonâ€™t work.
return
}
if GOOS == â€œdarwinâ€ && (GOARCH == â€œarmâ€ || GOARCH == â€œarm64â€) && !iscgo {
return

runtime/preempt.go



// xiaorui.cc



//go:generate go run mkpreempt.go



// asyncPreempt saves all user registers and calls asyncPreempt2.
//
// When stack scanning encounters an asyncPreempt frame, it scans that
// frame and its parent frame conservatively.
func asyncPreempt()



//go:nosplit
func asyncPreempt2() {
gp := getg()
gp.asyncSafePoint = true
if gp.preemptStop {
mcall(preemptPark)
} else {
mcall(gopreempt_m)
}
gp.asyncSafePoint = false
}

// xiaorui.cc



// preemptPark parks gp and puts it in _Gpreempted.
//
//go:systemstack
func preemptPark(gp *g) {
,,,
status := readgstatus(gp)
if status&^_Gscan != _Grunning {
dumpgstatus(gp)
throw(â€œbad g statusâ€)
}
,,,

func goschedImpl(gp *g) {

,,,
casgstatus(gp, _Grunning, _Grunnable)

lock(&sched.lock)
globrunqput(gp)
unlock(&sched.lock)

// xiaorui.cc



func netpoll(delay int64) gList {
,,,
var events [128]epollevent
retry:

println(â€œruntime: epollwait on fdâ€, epfd, â€œfailed withâ€, -n)
throw(â€œruntime: netpoll failedâ€)

}

}



func netpollBreak() {
for {
var b byte
n := write(netpollBreakWr, unsafe.Pointer(&b), 1)
if n == 1 {
break
}
if n == -_EINTR {
continue
}
,,,
}
}

// xiaorui.cc



// Print a list of signal names. These are found in /usr/include/linux/signal.h



kill -l



1) SIGHUP 2) SIGINT 3) SIGQUIT 4) SIGILL 5) SIGTRAP
6) SIGABRT 7) SIGBUS 8) SIGFPE 9) SIGKILL 10) SIGUSR1
11) SIGSEGV 12) SIGUSR2 13) SIGPIPE 14) SIGALRM 15) SIGTERM
16) SIGSTKFLT 17) SIGCHLD 18) SIGCONT 19) SIGSTOP 20) SIGTSTP
21) SIGTTIN 22) SIGTTOU 23) SIGURG 24) SIGXCPU 25) SIGXFSZ
26) SIGVTALRM 27) SIGPROF 28) SIGWINCH 29) SIGIO 30) SIGPWR
31) SIGSYS

åœ¨Linuxä¸­çš„posixçº¿ç¨‹æ¨¡å‹ä¸­ï¼Œçº¿ç¨‹æ‹¥æœ‰ç‹¬ç«‹çš„è¿›ç¨‹å·ï¼Œå¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡getpid()å¾—åˆ°çº¿ç¨‹çš„è¿›ç¨‹å·ï¼Œè€Œçº¿ç¨‹å·ä¿å­˜åœ¨pthread_tçš„å€¼ä¸­ã€‚è€Œä¸»çº¿ç¨‹çš„è¿›ç¨‹å·å°±æ˜¯æ•´ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹çš„è¿›ç¨‹å·ï¼Œå› æ­¤å‘ä¸»è¿›ç¨‹å‘é€ä¿¡å·åªä¼šå°†ä¿¡å·å‘é€åˆ°ä¸»çº¿ç¨‹ä¸­å»ã€‚å¦‚æœä¸»çº¿ç¨‹è®¾ç½®äº†ä¿¡å·å±è”½ï¼Œåˆ™ä¿¡å·ä¼šæŠ•é€’åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªå¯ä»¥å¤„ç†çš„çº¿ç¨‹ä¸­å»ã€‚



æ³¨å†Œçš„ä¿¡å·å¤„ç†å‡½æ•°éƒ½æ˜¯çº¿ç¨‹å…±äº«çš„ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªä¿¡å·åªå¯¹åº”ä¸€ä¸ªå¤„ç†å‡½æ•°ï¼Œä¸”æœ€åä¸€æ¬¡ä¸ºå‡†ã€‚å­çº¿ç¨‹ä¹Ÿå¯æ›´æ”¹ä¿¡å·å¤„ç†å‡½æ•°ï¼Œä¸”éšæ—¶éƒ½å¯æ”¹ã€‚



å¤šçº¿ç¨‹ä¸‹å‘é€åŠæ¥æ”¶ä¿¡å·çš„é—®é¢˜ï¼Ÿ



é»˜è®¤æƒ…å†µä¸‹åªæœ‰ä¸»çº¿ç¨‹æ‰å¯å¤„ç†signalï¼Œå°±ç®—æŒ‡å®šå­çº¿ç¨‹å‘é€signalï¼Œä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸»çº¿ç¨‹æ¥æ”¶å¤„ç†ä¿¡å·ã€‚



é‚£ä¹ˆGolangå¦‚ä½•åšåˆ°ç»™æŒ‡å®šå­çº¿ç¨‹å‘signalä¸”å¤„ç†çš„ï¼Ÿå¦‚ä½•æŒ‡å®šç»™æŸä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å‘é€signalï¼Ÿ åœ¨glibcä¸‹å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨pthread_killæ¥ç»™çº¿ç¨‹å‘signalï¼Œå®ƒåº•å±‚è°ƒç”¨çš„æ˜¯SYS_tgkillç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨ã€‚



golang signal
// xiaorui.cc



#include â€œpthread_impl.hâ€



int pthread_kill(pthread_t t, int sig)
{
int r;
__lock(t->killlock);
r = t->dead ? ESRCH : -__syscall(SYS_tgkill, t->pid, t->tid, sig);
__unlock(t->killlock);
return r;
}
é‚£ä¹ˆåœ¨go runtime/sys_linux_amd64.sé‡Œæ‰¾åˆ°äº†SYS_tgkillçš„æ±‡ç¼–å®ç°ã€‚os_linux.goä¸­signalMè°ƒç”¨çš„å°±æ˜¯tgkillçš„å®ç°ã€‚



// xiaorui.cc
#define SYS_tgkill 234



TEXT Â·tgkill(SB),NOSPLIT,$0
MOVQ tgid+0(FP), DI
MOVQ tid+8(FP), SI
MOVQ sig+16(FP), DX
MOVL $SYS_tgkill, AX
SYSCALL
RET
// xiaorui.cc



func tgkill(tgid, tid, sig int)



// signalM sends a signal to mp.
func signalM(mp *m, sig int) {
tgkill(getpid(), int(mp.procid), sig)
}
æ€»ç»“ï¼š



éšç€goç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸æ–­æ›´æ–°ï¼Œruntimeçš„åŠŸèƒ½è¶Šæ¥è¶Šå®Œå–„ã€‚ç°åœ¨çœ‹æ¥åŸºäºä¿¡å·çš„æŠ¢å å¼è°ƒåº¦æ˜¾å¾—å¾ˆç²¾å¦™ã€‚ä¸‹ä¸€ç¯‡æ–‡ç« ç»§ç»­å†™go1.4 deferçš„ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œç®€å•è¯´åœ¨å¤šåœºæ™¯ä¸‹ç¼–è¯‘å™¨æ¶ˆé™¤äº†deferprocå‹å…¥å’Œdeferreturnæ’å…¥è°ƒç”¨ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯ç›´æ¥è°ƒç”¨å»¶è¿Ÿæ–¹æ³•ã€‚
